channel.title: Comments on: What’s Missing From Google Contacts

item.title: By: Kathi
item.dc:creator: Kathi
item.description: I would love to use Google contacts, but still rely on Outlook for this, due to the limited fields. I need the birthday, anniversary, and website fields to sync with my mobile device. I also want my contact photos to be able to sync between Google and my mobile. Until that is possible, I'm stuck with Outlook.
item.content:encoded: I would love to use Google contacts, but still rely on Outlook for this, due to the limited fields. I need the birthday, anniversary, and website fields to sync with my mobile device. I also want my contact photos to be able to sync between Google and my mobile. Until that is possible, I’m stuck with Outlook.

item.title: By: Pd
item.dc:creator: Pd
item.description:
Its a shame on google, that their contacts app does not have a birthday field.
Bye
pd
item.content:encoded:
Its a shame on google, that their contacts app does not have a birthday field.

Bye

pd

item.title: By: Bodvar Bjorgvinsson
item.dc:creator: Bodvar Bjorgvinsson
item.description:
Joseph,
Thank you for this excellent blog article.
I found your blog when googling "FrameMaker" "Subversion" (which I have not finished reading). I have been using Gmail Contacts more and more and find it very good, but limiting in some of the ways you describe here. Some I don't use anyway, so those issues have not bothered me, like the Skype and photos.
Back to reading the "Subversion Success". )
Bodvar
item.content:encoded:
Joseph,

Thank you for this excellent blog article.

I found your blog when googling “FrameMaker” “Subversion” (which I have not finished reading). I have been using Gmail Contacts more and more and find it very good, but limiting in some of the ways you describe here. Some I don’t use anyway, so those issues have not bothered me, like the Skype and photos.

Back to reading the “Subversion Success”. )

Bodvar
